dish_name: Bok Choy and Vegetable Chow Mein
description: Dive into the vibrant world of Asian cuisine with this Bok Choy and Vegetable Chow Mein! This delightful dish features tender bok choy paired with a colorful medley of fresh vegetables stir-fried to perfection with chewy chow mein noodles.
ingredients: [{"name": "Chow mein noodles", "units": "oz", "amount": "8"}, {"name": "Garlic", "units": "cloves, minced", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "Ginger", "units": "tablespoon, minced", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Mushrooms", "units": "cup, sliced", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Carrots", "units": "cup, julienned", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Bell peppers", "units": "cup, thinly sliced", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Snow peas", "units": "cup, trimmed", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Bok choy", "units": "cups, chopped", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "Green onions", "units": "sliced", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "Sesame seeds", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "Vegetable broth", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "Soy sauce", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "Sesame oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "Cornstarch", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Salt", "units": "to taste", "amount": null}, {"name": "Pepper", "units": "to taste", "amount": null}]
instructions: Cook the chow mein noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, vegetable broth, cornstarch, salt, and pepper until well combined. Set aside. Heat a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add a tablespoon of vegetable oil and swirl to coat the pan. Add the minced garlic and ginger, stir-frying for about 30 seconds until fragrant. Introduce the sliced mushrooms, julienned carrots, and thinly sliced bell peppers to the pan. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables begin to soften. Add the chopped bok choy and snow peas, stir-frying for another 2 minutes until the bok choy wilts slightly. Pour the prepared sauce mixture over the vegetables and stir well to coat. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens. Add the cooked chow mein noodles to the wok, tossing to combine with the vegetables and sauce. Cook for another 2 minutes to heat through. Remove from heat and garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds. Serve hot and enjoy the explosion of flavors!
notes: For added protein, consider adding tofu, chicken, or shrimp to the stir-fry. Feel free to substitute any seasonal vegetables you have on hand to make this dish your own. For a spicier kick, add red pepper flakes or a drizzle of sriracha to the sauce.
